name: Rudding Park Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had one of the rooms in the new wing which was lovely so no compliants about the room, the spa is due to open soon but I think it's a shame that they haven't included a pool or hydrotherapy pool. Our main problem with our stay was dining in the restaurant our main reason for staying here was to sample their fine dining a la carte menu so were surprised to be given a very basic 3 course set menu when I enquired to the person who appeared to be in charge I was told this was the only menu available and what sounded like a a lame excuse of been let down by suppliers!!!?? The restaurant is quite large and the place was packed must have been well over a 100 people dining so i would doubt they could provide fine dining for that many people either that or they didn't have enough chefs in as it was new years day. So had to make do with what seemed to be function food a pre done pate with a bit of salad a carvery main course and a crumble the food was ok but was the kind of food you get in a pub. This was extremely disappointing as we were celebrating a special occasion and totally spoiled the evening if they had told us at the time of booking or even explained at check in as they knew we were dining in the restaurant that evening at least we could have lowered our expectations or maybe dined elsewhere. Also the bar/restaurant wasn't what I was expecting in a country hotel it felt like I was in a city centre hotel as it was in the new wing and was very modern and a bit souless and doesn't seem to make the most of its location or the views although the conservatory seemed nicer.
reviews.title: Hotel ok but restaurant a let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall we won't be back and I wouldn't recommend, if you like fine dining in a stunning country hotel you'd be better off going to swinton park where we stayed the following day, which if you drop on a deal is a similar price to stay.
reviews.title: Amazing new rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Also on check out we were charged £8 for breakfast delivery to our room but on the breakfast form it states £2.50 per person so should have been £5 I tried to explain at check out but they basically wouldn't have it, so wasn't going to argue too much over £ 3 but it's the principal.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea in the Clocktower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rudding Park is one of our all- time favourites. The staff are incredibly attentive and friendly whilst remaining unobtrusive. On this occasion we were lucky to be upgraded to one of the new suites. The new rooms are fabulous - very tastefully furnished with the most comfortable beds, and bathrooms to die for (claw foot bath, TV and even its own steam room!) Champagne and a welcome card from the management were a nice touch. Moulton Brown toiletries and bathrobes are provided as well as a well-stocked hospitality tray with fresh coffee and biscuits. Turn-down service provides bottled water and a cute massager. Everywhere is spotlessly clean and well maintained. Food and service in the Clocktower is always of a very high standard. Rudding Park definitely deserves its top hotel award.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for afternoon tea on 12/12/10, it was a little pre Christmas treat and I would definately return. For £25 we had festive sandwiches, any drink, a huge scone and a selection of deserts. It is very filling and more fun than going for a normal meal. The staff were fabulous and made us feel really special. We strolled around the hotel and grounds afterwards and did not feel hurried in anyway. I look forwards to our return.
reviews.title: If you want to be treated like royalty this is the place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: Our first stay was last New Years Eve, we had such a great time we booked in for another stay in June, again everything was fantastic. Based on our experiences we did not hesitate to book New Year 2011.
reviews.title: 3rd time not so lucky!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay: a very Warm welcome from reception, so well done, however, it soon became clear that cost cutting measures had been put in place( despite the increase in price).
reviews.title: Very dissatisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The New Years Eve canapes were a great disappointment, compared to last year and the champagne was of very poor quality.
reviews.title: Wonderful start to the year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was, as usual, first class, once they got it right! My partner and I both like our steak rare, (mine blue). We ordered this both on new years eve and day, both times both out steaks came Medium!!! When ordering on new years day the waiter explained that the chef had been too busy the previous night to cook my steak blue! (why were both medium?). However, both times the steaks were taken away and the requested steaks delivered, and they were amazing!!
reviews.title: Excellent in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: There have been obvious cutbacks, which are making use think twice about returning to Rudding Park in the near future, but it is a good hotel with very friendly and attentive staff.
reviews.title: Simply fantastic - the best hotel we've ever stayed at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed for 2 nights and couldn't have wished for a better experience. The hotel itself was tastefully decorated and even though there was contruction work adjoining the main building we didn't notice it until we were asked if we would like to see the plans for the new spa.
reviews.title: A relaxing stay in a beautiful hotel with fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well appointed and spotless and when our TV wouldn't work, the staff could have been more helpful and fixed it immediately.
reviews.title: Pampered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight has to be the staff who, without exception, were friendly, helpful and seem to genuinely care about the level of service they provided.
reviews.title: A Dream Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: There is no question that we would return and have already recommended it to several of our friends.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked in for one night for my husband's birthday.Sorry I didn't book for longer.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for a quiet and peaceful country getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 6th visit and superb in everyway as usual. A big thank you to the hotel for the upgrade on the occasion of my husband's birthday. Evening meal and breakfast brilliant. Big thank you to all the staff particularly Robert in the restaurant. Now planning 7th visit!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed a couple of times before but on works conferences so never got the chance to really maximise the experience. What struck me was the attention to detail and a focus on personal recognition. The rooms are stunning with fabulous facilities and the food in the Clocktower restaurant was excellent. The real difference was the fact that every member of staff we came across know we were there to celebrate our anniversary, we got a complimentary upgrade and had a bottle of pink champagne on ice when we arrived in the room. All in great surrounds just a few miles from Harrogate. This hotel is not the cheapest but still pound for pound good value give n the facilities and service.
reviews.title: Outstanding anniversary experience at Rudding Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I had a business meeting in Harrogate, and decided to make the most of the opportunity to see the area. We did a little research and found that Rudding Park Hotel was voted the best hotel in the UK, the 2nd best hotel in Europe, and the 4th best hotel in the world - according to their website? I booked a room with breakfast and an evening meal, even though I thought it was a little expensive I thought the quality would be worth it.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was good but it I was by no means awestruck, after a long day we decided to have a drink and relax. The prices of the mini bar were ridiculous, so we went to the bar. I ordered two bottles of lager and two glasses of wine which came to just over £20. We then went through to the Clock Tower restaurant for our meal.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was good to be fair but I found the service somewhat like a conveyor belt as If our table was on short term lease, I did feel a little rushed but maybe it was a busy night?
reviews.title: 10 out of 10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful Hotel. Really great staff and a fabulous evening meal in the restaurant. Very relaxing. Looking forward to revisiting. Highly recommended
reviews.title: Fantastic Sevice and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Rudding Park for a wedding and we were surprised and delighted by the quality of the accomodation, the food and above all the service. I don't remember such exceptional service ever before. All of the staff were professional, friendly and helpful without being obsequious.
reviews.title: Fantastic service with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a real pleasure staying there
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say about this hotel that has probably not already been said, the staff are so polite and nothing is too much trouble for anyone from the minute you check in, to the minute you check out.
reviews.title: Top class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff talk to you as if you are the only people there and shown a real interest in you, which is very pleasing.
reviews.title: Thank You Rudding Park.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and attentiveness at Rudding Park are outstanding at this lovely peaceful hotel set in beautiful grounds. All members of staff were extremely pleasant and professional. We booked a standard double room and loved the wonderfully comfortable king size bed and the power shower was glorious with Molton Brown toiletries in bathroom. Dinner and breakfast in restaurant were superb, especially the Yorkshire cooked breakfast. RHS Harlow Carr gardens nearby, and shopping in Harrogate. We have booked again for a week in July. A lovely retreat from the fast pace of modern living.
reviews.title: A thoroughly top notch hotel with amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Rudding Park with my husband for his birthday, booked on the play and stay rate which included bed, breakfast, 3 course evening meal and a round of golf. From the minute we arrived in the car park everything was perfect, the porter rushed out as soon as we parked up and took our bags, check in was extremely quick and very friendly receptionist. Room lovely, extremely comfortable bed, fantastic power shower, molton brown smellies in the bathroom. We went for a walk around the beautiful grounds in the afternoon and when we came back to the room there was a small bottle of champagne in the room which had been left for my husband with a card wishing him happy birthday from Rudding Park. We were asked if we wanted the bed turning down and were given a complimentary little massager in the shape of ladybird, lovely little touch. Excellent food in the Clockhouse restaurant both at Lunch and Evening Meal, staff excellent, extremely friendly and couldn't do enough for you, again the little touches make such a difference, when the waitress brought our petit fours with our coffee the plate had 'Happy Birthday' written on it in chocolate. The conservatory is a lovely light airy room to eat your meals in but all areas are very well presented and comfortable. Breakfast outstanding, so nice to have your cooked breakfast actually cooked fresh instead of these buffet type serve yourself hotel breakfasts, excellent choice of breakfast too. My husband said the golf course was one of the best he has played on. Would highly recommend this hotel, close to Harrogate for the ladies to shop whilst hubby plays golf.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I've Stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We plus guide dog thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had a dinner bed and breakfast deal for one night,which was excellent value. The food was superb and sourced locally. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent country house break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was dog friendly, in that it had french windows accessing a patio and the grounds. a bowl and blanket were provided for the dog.
reviews.title: If you want to be spoiled - this is the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though there was building work taking place, it was discreet and did not impact on our stay.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, amazing welcome!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We decided to break a long Christmas road trip to Loch Lomond in Harrogate, both on the way North and back South. I had no hesitation in booking into one of our favourite hotels, Rudding Park. This time however the hotel excelled itself. On both visits we were offered complimentary cimema viewings and on the return a complimentary room upgrade. Staff were very helpful and breakfasts were a treat(as always). A great experience at very reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Delightful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent New Year at Rudding Park. The rooms were excellent and the staff service second to none! Sadly the food did not live up to our expectations, but the atmosphere made up for it. The New Year Party, whilst expensive, was great fun.A nice touch was the complementary "hangover pack" left outside every room on New Years Morning!
reviews.title: Superb service in excellent atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second time experiencing the joys of bringing in the New Year at Rudding Park and it was every bit as good as the first. From checking in to checking out, even down to the front desk team trying to find me a power supply for my laptop which I had forgotten to pack. Thanks to Toni and his team for that!
reviews.title: A Rudding good stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay for an extra night this year so arrived on the 30th and stayed through to 2nd January. This allowed me to use the fantastic gym facilities which given the amount of excellent food I was to consume over the next few days was extremely useful.
reviews.title: Amazing Anniversary and Boxing Day Lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked one of the rooms in the new wing, which I have to say despite reading a negative comment on TA recently, is right up my street from an interior design point of view. I suppose it’s each to their own when it comes to the more subjective elements of any hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last weekend of January for my birthday.
reviews.title: Customer Orientated Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic food at restaurant with very friendly staff. Very Good breakfast choice available with attentive service.
reviews.title: Lovely staff and a great stay despite a few flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: Stayed in the new wing, the rooms are extremely spacious with good quality furniture/fittings. There were a few problems due to the room being new, some snagging faults, but the hotel was willing to compensated my partner for this.
reviews.title: It's obvious why this hotel wins awards!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room facilities as you would expect from this Hotel - bathrobes, good quality toiletries etc
reviews.title: Unparalleled service from the moment we arrived.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel common areas very well looked after and made a pleasantly comfortable area to relax in.
reviews.title: fab hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sometimes you find a gem you don't want to share, but that would be unfair to everyone else. I arrived for a two night stay with my partner and 4 other members of family and friends. From the moment we arrived till the moment we left the personal attention we received made us all feel as if we were the only guests there.If you are ever in Harrogate make sure you visit Rudding Park
reviews.title: What a fantastic way to spend a New Years EVe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent my 50th birthday here and was blown away by the friendliness and willingness to help of all the staff, I even received a card and bottle of very nice champagne on ice in our room on arrival.
reviews.title: A most enjoyable place to stay with staff that make you want to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Attention to detail is amazing I have never seen such a clean and shinier w/c anywhere and the shower is very powerful and as hot as you like, even the complimentary soaps are quality.
reviews.title: Happy New Year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad points - Weather, but it was coldest December on record. Not that we noticed in our lovely warm room with lovely comfy bed. If you’re like me and don’t sleep in hotel beds very well then this is the place for you.
reviews.title: I fully recommend this excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Would I recommend it too you - absolutely!
reviews.title: Excellent in all respects

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 night break at Rudding Park. First impressions were great with a very good check-in service and very friendly staff taking luggage to our rooms. Our room was well appointed, with a lovely comfortable bed and the room was very clean. However, for a hotel of this standard, certain things let it down. For a 4 Star hotel I would expect the bed linen to have a higher thread count. In addition, the tiles surrounding the bath had black bacteria on the grout and some rotten wood around the bath surround. However, the service we experienced was very good with room service happily bringing fresh milk for tea up to our room. Another small complaint is that we always had to phone to request more tea bags as these were not replenished at either turn down service or when servicing our room in the morning. The restaurant in the hotel was lovely, with friendly staff and atmosphere. We had to eat at 1900 as the restaurant was so busy. Don't quite know why as both my husband and I found the restaurant very disappointing. The menu is not particularly exciting (and there is a choice of 3 to choose from) and is over priced for the quality and standard of the food. I had the 'special, roast sirloin with Yorkshire pudding and winter veg. The winter veg consisted of small balls of potatoes that were undercooked. An additional bowl of veg came that consisted of carrots, again, undercooked, and more potatoes and parsnips. My 'sirloin, consisted of 2 slices of beef, wafer thin, with a hard, overcooked and very dry Yorkshire pudding. It is quite clear you are paying for your surroundings, not for the quality or the ingredients of the food. At £19 for my main course, it is overpriced. And this was not just at dinner, breakfast too was over rated. Very few cereals to choose from, a small cold buffet, with emphasis on the cooked breakfasts. I had eggs Benedict. The holandaise was horrible, thick and more like scrambled eggs. On the second day I had haddock, nice, but with only a poached egg on the side, it wasn't special, it could have done with a sauce. I ordered wholemeal toast on both days and it did not appear. Bread is poor quality white and not very 'toasted, more like normal bread. Service at breakfast is poor and slow. Rudding Park is a lovely place to stay, but isn't cheap, so for the price I expect better service and better quality food. I would return, but I would not eat in the restaurant and I would hope that the service and breakfast improves.
reviews.title: Rudding Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, and I've stayed in a lot across the world. Came for a romantic 2 day New Year break and, despite dreadful weather, had a wonderful time. The staff are amazing. Receptionists, porters, cleaners, restaurant and bar staff were all attentive, friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful and has employed a great interior designer. Every piece of furniture is well chosen - trendy and colourful, but comfortable. The rooms have huge beds and bathrooms with Molton Brown toiletries. The hotel brings you fresh milk and cookies on request so that you can make your own tea in your room. Huge flat screen TV with all the sports channels (made my husband very happy). The food in the restaurant was delicious - a lot of it sourced locally from Yorkshire (there is a separate Yorkshire Food Heroes menu). I had the vegetarian millefeuille one night, and the pheasant the next, both of which were fantastic. One pudding didn't live up to its billing, so we sent it back, and it was immediately removed from our bill, no questions asked. You don't get hotels much better than this - I can only think of one in Osaka and one in Queensland which come close in my experience. Thank you Rudding Park for a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for one night on route home. Lovely welcome when the hotel porter appeared at the side of the car to help. It was dark and cold as he expertly loaded our bags over his shoulders and lead us to the entrance. Wow! A huge real fire blazed in the entrance and we immediately felt impressed and thought we had found somewhere special!
reviews.title: Perfect stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant - fabulous food and wine. Good service and a buzzing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Best uk hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was well furnished and decorated. Nice touches like turn back, complimentary water, tea and coffee making facilities. Our son especially liked the giant cookie that had his name on it!
reviews.title: a lovely wedding venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel in a peaceful location, well appointed rooms and very helpful staff. We had a dinner, bed and breakfast rate. dinner was very good without being excellent, breakfast was superb, however there was a wedding on that morning and while I am not a prude I dislike seeing people in onesies and pajamas at breakfast. My wife enjoyed the Spa immensely, but the hotel would benefit from a swimming pool.
reviews.title: Peaceful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay again - definitely
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an amazing stay at Rudding Park. The staff were absolutely lovely (booking, welcome, service, checkout) and the well-designed room, which had a gorgeous terrace, was beautiful with some cool original touches. Nothing was too much trouble; it seemed that ethos of the hotel was geared around providing a truly luxurious stay for its guests. I really wish we'd been staying for more than one night, but we will definitely be back, and we'll stay for longer next time. I can't recommend it highly enough and I'm quite a picky bugger!
reviews.title: Birthday Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Recently stayed for my 50th Birthday on a one night Dinner Bed and Breakfast offer 12th November, from the moment we arrived we were made to feel very special and the room upgrade and champagne were really appreciated, have to say the best hotel experience we have ever had.Already booked again for my wifes 50th in March with Spa an added bonus this time. Already recommended to friends and colleages as a must visit.. see you in March.
reviews.title: The perfect weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013
reviews.text: Spent the weekend here with a friend and couldn't fault the place!
reviews.title: Great location and building, not so great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night on 6th April with my husband to celebrate our wedding aniversary. I could not fault anything about this hotel. I had mentioned on booking that it was our wedding aniversary and was delighted to find we had been upgraded to a suite. What a lovely gesture. A half bottle of champagne and a card had been left in the bedroom for us. The suite was lovely, very clean and comfortable. We had dinner in the Clocktower and could not find fault with either the food or service. All staff that we came in contact with were excellent. This hotel fully deserves all the fantastic reviews. Thank you Rudding Park for making our stay very special.
reviews.title: Rudding Park, It doesnt get better than this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife stayed over on Easter Sunday for our wedding anniversary and enjoyed our visit greatly. The hotel is a lovely mixture of new and old with the standard room that we stayed in being very nice and on offer at a reasonable price. However the best thing about the hotel is the customer service of all members of staff who can not do enough to help you. We even found a surprise bottle of champagne in our room as it was our anniversary even though this had only been briefly mentioned when ringing up to book dinner. I would highly recommend this hotel purely for its excellent customer service which unfortunately you do not often get in this country. We will be visiting again - Fantastic!
reviews.title: Fabulous break - excellent service
Always Stunningly Good
reviews.text: We live in Harrogate but I thought I'd add to the favourable reviews of Rudding Park too. Food: wonderful, Service: impeccable, Price: you pay for exclusivity, Atmosphere: Reserved, Peaceful, Utterly Relaxing, Surroundings: It's Harrogate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here for a management conference in the hotel and we were completely blown away by it. The food was amazing, the staff were super attentive, the location is astounding and we can't praise the experience enough.
reviews.title: Fabulous from the start to the end

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They even put us in touch with an outdoor pursuits company who used their grounds for the team building exercises.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience at Rudding Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Rudding Park was excellent, the reception staff were extremely helpful on arrival, the food was delicious and our room in the new Folifoot Wing was outstanding!
reviews.title: Special Occassion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is the second time I have visited this hotel and I can honestly say this is the best hotel in england. The service level in this hotel is similar to service in America or the far east. I agree with the previous commentator who comments that the turn down service should be later. This though is a minor thing and is completely forgiven because everything else is so fantastic.
reviews.title: New year's eve package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel appeared to be full. But that did not result in a compromised service. The food was excellent and I feel I must mention the excellent service from Thomas and nicholaj in the restaurant. Both these young men would not be out of place in the Dorchester or ritz. I will be returning to rudding park again and would not hestitate to recommend this hotel to the most discerning.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay, once again, was very relaxing and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Fab u lous Darling!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff always make us feel very welcome and our room was wonderful.
reviews.title: Fab 5* experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here recently for two nights to celebrate my birthday. We were a little disappointed as although some aspects were excellent, others were not up to scratch.
reviews.title: Variable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent:: The welcome at reception, including valet parking, porter and receptionist to accompany us to room. On arrival in room two glasses of sparking wine and a birthday card were awaiting. (I had been asked when booking whether I was coming for a special occasion.) Given the large numbers of guests who must be coming for a special occasion this was a generous gesture and much appreciated. We also appreciated the interactive television in the room which had cd tracks stored on it and the free service offering over 80 dvd's and a player on request.
reviews.title: Birthday Treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very Good: The Ribston room which was comfortable and had everything we needed. Housekeeping and turn-down service were much appreciated. Dinner on the second evening was very good, (fine dining type dishes,but with generous portions), as was the service.
reviews.title: Castlings 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Average: Shortly after arriving we enquired about afternoon tea and were directed to the bar. The sandwiches and cakes were good, but we were not offered a choice of teas and had to ask for pastry forks. This was not a relaxing experience and on reflection we feel we should have found one of the many quiet spots in the hotel and asked for tea to be served there. Our first evening dinner (Sunday) was a disappointment. The set menu consisted mainly of Sunday roasts which would have been fine, but the food tasted as if it had been re-heated or kept warm and the roast potatoes were barely warm. Service was also haphazard and I found the restaurant a little bleak.
reviews.title: Luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Poor: On our first breakfast my eggs benedict was only just warm and my husband's scrambled egg tasted burnt, even though it wasn't. On our second breakfast my fried eggs seemed to have an inedible layer underneath like paper. I have to say, though, that service at breakfast was good. We perhaps should have complained at the time, but really it should have been better in the first place.
reviews.title: Great conference venue
Stunning golf course
reviews.text: Rudding Park golf course is spectacular. Fantastic scenery and a well maintained, immaculate manicured course. The halfway house is great, as when you finish playing the 8th hole you place your order and collect as you finish the 10th hole. It's a great set up with no hold ups from purchases from the halfway house!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 6hole Par3 replica of famous championship holes "is a must" for all golfers of any level of expertise.
reviews.title: Superb!
Perfect wedding venue
reviews.text: Including Wentworth, Carnoustie, St Andrews, in UK and Augusta and Sawgrass USA.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The club house bar sell a variety of good food and beverages.
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done Rudding Park. Excellent !!
reviews.title: recent stay
An unpleasant welcome...
reviews.text: One small, rather unsavoury experience does not make Rudding Park a bad hotel but the embarrassing and rather apathetic way in which we were greeted at reception when we arrived for a Christmas party night in December was an occasion I would not want to repeat and one which has certainly discouraged me from returning. A previous stay at Rudding went without a hitch and it may have been that the two members of staff working reception on this particular evening were new to the job or had had a bad day but I would go as far as to say I was treated with disdain on arrival and made to feel unwelcome when in fact we had travelled looking forward to a night of festive fun. We booked for four people the previous day and the organiser was very helpful over the telephone, but when we eventually made it through to the party room itself some 48 hours or so later, there was no table set, no-one knew we were coming and we were once again left embarrassed at the bar whilst someone went in search of a table! When I explained what had happened, the party organiser did everything in her power to rectify matters (hence I haven’t marked the hotel less the four blobs on this occasion so as not to spoil their unblemished Trip Advisor track record); she even gave us a free bottle of wine! But the fact is, the night had been spoiled at this point - and as if matters could not get any worse, word hadn’t filtered through that we don’t eat meat, so there was nothing to eat. Again, the party organiser did the best she could under the circumstances but nevertheless, this is a night we will remember for a very long time but for all the wrong reasons. Oh, and by way of explanation, this review is late because the party organiser promised feedback from Rudding management but nothing has been forthcoming. I expect however, they may reply here and try to defend these comments as they have done with other negative reviews, when in fact it would be much more laudable just to let any minor criticisms speak for themselves.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A thoroughly well run and friendly hotel within a rural location but yet near enough to hit the town for a change. Luxurious rooms with loads of personal touches from the staff to make you feel welcome and relaxed.
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had an excellent Business Conference during the day at Rudding Park in glorious grounds and a wonderful building all of which was fully supported by a fantastic lunch and tea and coffee services during the breaks.
reviews.title: Rewarding and comfortable Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However as always, you may have been overwhelmed with the oppulence and setting for this meeting during the day but you can't help getting that special buzz when you enter your room for the evening. To top it all the service received has never been matched from anywhere else where I have stayed.
reviews.title: Top quality service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its a real pleasure to stay at Rudding Park and the team who work there make it so. Its a credit to them all.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

description: The award winning Rudding Park lies just two miles south of Harrogate and thirty minutes north of Leeds. The 4 red star hotel boasts 90 luxury bedrooms, a 2 AA Rosette Clocktower Restaurant, a spa, small gym, 14 seat private cinema and 15 self-contained Conference and Banqueting rooms. Rudding Park's 18 hole golf course and 6 hole Repton Short Course run through the existing 300 acre parkland and provide a challenge for even the most seasoned golfer.
